intro: Chytranthus carneus, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Chytranthus carneus is often found in rocky crevices and is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
